intro: Bequaertiodendron oblanceolatum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed bequaertiodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its elongated, lance-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a decorative plant.
